CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 9, 1945, pg. 21, reads: "Lionel Hampton and Marva Louis Are Acclaimed In Concert At Syria Mosque - The Aftermath - After the stirring swing concert at Syria Mosque Monday night, artists, as well as the audience, made a pilgrimage to the Loendi Club to finish the evening.  Teenie Harris, Courier staff photographer, trailed them and snapped these candid shots showing Marva Louis with admirers and Lionel Hampton surrounded by friends. - Harris Photo."Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1976, pg. 17, reads: "Remember When... The Crawford Grill was located at the corner of Wylie Avenue and Fullerton Street? It was a fabulous nitery; in glory days of the fabulous old Third Ward of Pittsburgh; at a fabulous time 'For livin'...all happening in the fast Forties!  Some of the world's most colorful characters and best-known personalities passed through the portals of the Grill in those days.  Take for example two of the personalities in the photo above: Woogie Harris and bandleader Lionel Hampton (third and second from right)......'Hey, looky 'here...here comes Too Sweet and Patchneck Red...and there's Rubbernose Jones and Oldsmobile Slim over in the corner...Hey, Pegaboo...Fastblack...Sonny Man...what's goin' on y'all?'...Yea (sigh) it was fabulous back there! - Teenie Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Five women, including Charlotte Enty Catlin, and four men, including William "Woogie" Harris and Lionel Hampton, seated at table in Loendi Club
